required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: [18F]FAraG PET Imaging for Analysis of Biodistribution in Cancer Patients Expected to Undergo Immunotherapy and/or Radiation Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: Study of the Kinetics, Dosimetry and Safety of [18F]F-AraG (VisAcT), a Positron Emission Tomography Tracer for Imaging the Activation of the Immune System in Cancer Patients Who Have Received or Are Expected to Receive Immunotherapy and/or Radiation Therapy

collaborator.agency: UCSF Imaging Center at China Basin

brief_summary.textblock: This is a Phase 1 study is to visualize biodistribution of a PET tracer called [18F]F-AraG (VisAcT) in cancer patients expected to undergo immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy.

detailed_description.textblock:
This is an exploratory Phase 1, prospective study assessing the biodistribution and radiation dosimetry of the Positron Emission Tomography [18F]FAraG (VisAcT) in cancer patients selected for immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy. Each patient may have up to two [ 18F]FAraG PET imaging sessions, a baseline scan and a post start of immunotherapy scan. For each imaging session, patients will receive a single injection of [18F]FAraG and undergo a whole-body PET scans an hour after injection of the tracer. Following each imaging session, the patient will be called within 72 hours to note any side effects.
Optional - Blood samples may be collected at up to 9 time points post-injection to analyze whole-blood/plasma time activity of [18F]FAraG in addition an urine sample may be collected post scan.

primary_outcome.measure: Visualize biodistribution of the PET tracer [18F]F-AraG pre-immunotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 6 weeks before immunotherapy is administered
primary_outcome.description: Whole-body [18F]F-AraG PET scan will be performed after intravenous injection of the PET tracer.consecutive time points the day of the intravenous injection of the PET tracer.

primary_outcome.measure: Visualize biodistribution of the PET tracer [18F]F-AraG post start of immunotherapy
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 12 weeks after start of immunotherapy
primary_outcome.description: Whole-body [18F]F-AraG PET scan will be performed after intravenous injection of the PET tracer.

intervention.description: Single dose IV injection of [18F]F-AraG for each imaging day.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cancer patients with identified tumor mass
- Cancer patients expected to undergo immunotherapy and/or radiation therapy
Exclusion Criteria:
- Under the age of 18
- Pregnant women
- Women who are breastfeeding
- Individuals with known or suspected substance abuse
- Individuals unable or unwilling to comply with the study procedures

overall_official.affiliation: UCSF Department of Radiology & Biomedical Imaging

facility.name: UCSF Imaging Center at China Basin
